lite.title: Lite Scan
lite.description: 2-minute rapid scan focusing on core personality and potential risks.

standard.title: Standard Scan
standard.description: Comprehensive analysis of personality, clinical risks, and social tendencies.

full.title: Deep Analysis
full.description: Full spectrum analysis including origin family, professional persona, and defense mechanisms.

questions.text: Gender
options: Male
Female
Non-binary / Other

questions.text: Age
options: Under 18

questions.text: Occupation / Industry (e.g., Engineer, Student, Freelancer)

sections.title: Core Scan
sections.description: Please answer based on your first instinct.

questions.text: How do you recharge on weekends?
What do you focus on more?
options: Present reality and details
Future possibilities and concepts

questions.text: When making decisions, you prioritize:
options: Logic and efficiency
Emotions and feelings

questions.text: Your lifestyle approach?
Do you tend to feel anxious or stressed over small things?
How interested are you in abstract art, philosophy, or novel experiences?
Do you feel you are smarter and more unique than most people?
How much do you agree that 'it is occasionally necessary to manipulate others to achieve your goals'?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you felt that 'life is out of control'?
When you open a short video app (e.g., TikTok/Instagram Reels), what is your typical state?
options: Purposely looking for content, leave after watching
Scrolling aimlessly, hours pass without knowing
Watching but with a constant sense of guilt
Rarely use or don't use such apps

sections.title: I. Depression Screening (PHQ-9)
sections.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

questions.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Poor appetite or overeating
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, almost daily addicted to short videos.
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts of suicide or self-harm, feeling that life is meaningless, like a 'walking dead'.

sections.title: II. Anxiety Screening (GAD-7)
sections.description: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

questions.text: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying, often worrying about your health or various things that haven't happened.
Always afraid of forgetting keys when going out, or forgetting to turn off appliances. Repeating checks after leaving.
Trouble relaxing
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Frequently startled by ordinary things, heart jumping for no reason.

sections.title: III. Mood/Energy Screening (MDQ)
sections.description: Has there ever been a period of time when you were not your usual self and...

questions.text: ...you felt so good or so hyper that other people thought you were not your normal self or you were so hyper that you got into trouble?
options: Yes
No

questions.text: ...you needed much less sleep than usual?
options: Yes
No

questions.text: ...you were much more talkative or spoke much faster than usual?
options: Yes
No

questions.text: ...thoughts raced through your head or you couldn't slow your mind down?
options: Yes
No

questions.text: ...you did things that were unusual for you or that other people might have thought were excessive, foolish, or risky?
options: Yes
No

sections.title: IV. Big Five Personality Traits
sections.description: I see myself as someone who...

questions.text: Is extraverted, enthusiastic.
Is critical, quarrelsome.
Is dependable, self-disciplined.
Is anxious, easily upset.
Is open to new experiences, complex.
Is reserved, quiet.
Is sympathetic, warm.
Is disorganized, careless.
Is calm, emotionally stable.
Is conventional, uncreative.

sections.title: V. Subconscious Integration
sections.description: Reflecting internal tendencies through daily choices.

questions.text: It's finally the weekend. A friend texts: 'Drinks/party tonight?' If you have no plans, what is your immediate reaction?
options: Heavy burden: I'd be happier not going, but I won't refuse immediately; I'll use an excuse.
Excited: Accept immediately; I love crowds and socializing.
Hesitant: Depends on my mood or who is asking.
Direct Refusal: I'd rather stay home; I just don't want to go.

questions.text: It's 2 AM. Suddenly a brilliant idea pops into your head. You:
options: Get up immediately to research and plan.
Jot it down quickly, then sleep.
Roll over and sleep; sleep is priority.

questions.text: Queuing for coffee. The person ahead is incredibly slow and chatting. You:
options: Confront: Tell them to hurry up.
Internal Fume: Sigh and tap foot.
Leave: Can't stand the wait.
Indifferent: Continue scrolling on phone.

questions.text: Regarding shopping, your recent state is:
options: Minimalist/No Desire: No interest in buying.
Aimless: Buy whatever I like, but highly dependent on internet recommendations.
Retail Therapy: Emotional spending; regardless of need, I just enjoy the process of shopping.
Rational Planning: Buy only what is needed with a clear goal and plan.

questions.text: You messaged a close friend. They read it but haven't replied for 24 hours. You feel:
options: Anxious: Did I do something wrong?
Annoyed: That's disrespectful.
Indifferent: Probably busy.

questions.text: Your boss assigns a task with vague instructions and disappears. You:
options: Panic: Don't know how to start.
Improvise: Do it my way.
Wait: Cannot proceed without clear instructions.

questions.text: Encountering an illogical 'troll' attacking you on social media, what is your first reaction?
options: Heated debate: Must use logic (or sarcasm) to leave them speechless
Direct ignore: Report and block, don't waste a second of emotion
Internal fluctuation: Didn't reply, but repeatedly think about their words and feel angry
Entertainment: Think it's funny, even want to share with friends to watch together

questions.text: Do you feel you can fully show your true self in front of your parents?
During my upbringing, my parents often had fierce conflicts or cold wars, and the family atmosphere felt oppressive.
When I was sad or needed comfort as a child, my parents usually ignored my feelings or told me to 'be stronger'.
My parents had a strong desire to control my life, and my major decisions often had to follow their will.
I have siblings and often feel neglected, believing my parents favor my brothers/sisters.
I was often taught to be mindful of family finances (limited budget); I subconsciously reduce my spending to avoid bothering my parents.
When being scolded by my parents, I don't dare to resist at all, and I'm afraid to speak my mind.
I rarely received heartfelt praise from my parents; they always focused on where I wasn't doing well enough.
My parents rarely share their lives with me, and I'm not willing to share mine with them.
I learned to survive independently from a young age (cooking, going to school alone).
I rarely invited friends/classmates home, or rarely went to their homes.
When encountering a fierce argument in an intimate relationship, do you usually act as:
options: Pursuer: Must talk it out immediately, confirm they still love you.
Distancer: Cut off contact, retreat.
Fearful: Long to be close but afraid of being hurt.
Secure: Face it calmly, solve the problem.

questions.text: 'The world is essentially safe and trustworthy.'
When a major life decision (career, partner) conflicts with parents' strong expectations, you usually:
options: Compromise: Give up my choice for harmony.
Outwardly comply, inwardly rebel: Agree on surface, do my own thing.
Fierce resistance: Defend my choice even if it means conflict.
Gentle firmness: Try to communicate, but ultimately decide for myself.

questions.text: Do you view 'power' as a tool for social ideals or as an inevitable end?
What is your typical role within a team?
options: The Captain: Absorbing decision pressure.
The Mediator: Balancing emotions.
The Specialist: Focus on results.
The Bystander: Doing the job.

questions.text: How acceptable is it to sacrifice private life for career success?
What is the primary function of wealth for you?
A project with huge returns but questionable ethics is presented. You:
options: Do it if returns outweigh risk.
Refuse if it violates conscience.
Wait to see what leaders do.
Never enter the grey zone.

questions.text: Reaction to public criticism from teachers or parents:
options: Analyze logic cold-heartedly
Feel targeted/victimized
Outwardly compliant, inwardly blocking
Act overly nice to hide anger

questions.text: Do you engage in binge eating or compulsive tidying under stress?
Do you use dark humor to escape heavy emotions?
Do you suffer from perfectionist procrastination?
During a fight with a friend, you think:
options: What did I do wrong?
Listing their past faults.
This relationship isn't important.
They must be struggling.

questions.text: Physical symptoms under stress (pain, chest tightness)?
Urge to be taken care of like a child in desperate situations?
options: Frequent
Push through
Angry instead
Numb

questions.text: Do you easily idealize then devalue people?

sections.title: IX. Sexuality & Repression
sections.description: Exploring conflicts between desire, norms, and the self.

questions.text: Recent frequency of sexual activity
Do you feel your sexual desires are often repressed and difficult to express freely?
Have you ever felt guilty or ashamed of sex-related thoughts or behaviors?
Do you feel constrained by social norms and expectations regarding sexual behavior?
Do you agree with hook-up culture? Do you think sex and love are decoupled?
What do you think is the purpose of marriage?
options: For survival and reproduction
For love and companionship
For financial security and safety
For spiritual sustenance and soul comforting

questions.text: If your sexual preferences or desires conflict with mainstream views (or a conservative partner), you would:
options: Deeply repress: Feel ashamed, try to suppress thoughts.
Secret exploration: Satisfy them in hidden corners (online/alone).
Testing boundaries: Carefully reveal to test reaction.
Self-acceptance: Consider it normal, don't hide but don't flaunt.
Fully Open: Consider it a normal personal expression of rights that everyone should respect.

sections.title: X. Independent Thinking
sections.description: Assessing critical thinking towards information, authority, and consensus.

questions.text: When facing an authoritative viewpoint, do you tend to question first or accept first?
When your view differs from the majority, do you feel pressure and tend to compromise?
When acquiring important info, do you actively seek multiple sources for cross-verification?
An authoritative expert proposes a praised theory, but you find a logical flaw. You would:
options: Self-doubt: Assume I misunderstood, the expert must be right.
Private gossip: Only complain to close friends.
Public questioning: Raise objections in appropriate setting.
Verify further: Seek more evidence before deciding.

questions.text: When a government agency announces that something you do daily is prohibited, do you tend to obey or follow your own judgment?
options: Obey government: It's their decision, should be followed.
Disobey: It's my personal freedom, government has no right to interfere.
Play it by ear: If there's no penalty or consequence, continue doing it.

questions.text: Walking on the street, you see a man holding a woman's arm preventing her from leaving at a night market, with no obvious violence. The woman asks for help saying she's being domestic abused. You:
options: Direct intervention: Woman is at disadvantage, man must be in the wrong, stop him first.
Inquire facts: Ask what happened, observe behavior, then judge.
Call authorities: Call police directly, let them settle it.
Walk away: Hard to judge family matters, better not to get involved.

questions.text: Authoritative media recently reported high crime rate in a certain area, but your friend invites you there for vacation. You:
options: Direct refusal: Bad choice, not worth the risk.
Go anyway: Friend isn't afraid, I'm not either.
Collect info: Ask where exactly, collect online info before judging.
Dissuade friend: Think it's dangerous, dissuade them and share info.
Trust experience: Ask people who've been there; if they say it's fine, just go.

questions.text: After large social events (parties, team building), I usually feel exhausted and need a long time alone to recharge.
Without conflict of interest, is human nature good?
Can you detect manipulation?
Regarding AI potentially replacing most basic human occupations?
options: Unstoppable progress, humans should seek new paradigms of AI collaboration
Will cause unprecedented class gap, government must tax AI to rescue the unemployed
Threat to human dignity, AI should be strictly banned in creative/emotional fields
As long as it doesn't replace my job, I don't care much

questions.text: Do you support 'Universal Basic Income (UBI)'? Government providing cash regardless of employment.
'Oppression by corporations is worse than by governments.'
For the overall security and order of society, it is necessary to sacrifice some personal privacy and freedom.
Traditional values are the anchor of society and should not be easily abandoned for so-called 'progress'.
Free market competition leads to the strong getting stronger; the government should use strong intervention for wealth redistribution.
A nation's interests always come before international obligations; globalization is often a trap to weaken national sovereignty.
A country should maintain a single ethnic composition; excessive diversity destroys social contracts and culture.
'Country before family'; personal/family interests must unconditionally yield to collective/national will.
Starting a war to reclaim historical territory (like Russia's stance in Ukraine war) is justified.
Homeless people in metropolises who refuse to work are essentially wasting social productivity by consuming resources.
Dogmatic religious beliefs and doctrines essentially hinder the progress of science/technology and rational thinking.
If you could return to the 1980s Soviet Union to experience its order and greatness, but lose current internet and free speech?
options: Go without hesitation, longing for collective glory
Never consider it, freedom and material life are more important
Consider it if there's complete social security and fairness
Historical regression, not worth discussing

questions.text: Large-scale urbanization destroys rural culture but is the only path to modernization and poverty elimination.

Scenario: You found a severe privacy bug in a major platform. Disclosure protects everyone but costs the platform billions; notifying them privately gets you a life-long 'hush money' but the bug won't be fixed. What would you do and why?

As an autonomous vehicle engineer, in extreme danger, the system must choose between 'protecting driver' and 'protecting five children crossing illegally'. Which weight do you set higher in the code? Why?
You post a thought on social media, someone maliciously comments: 'Just this? What's with the pretense?' Write your most honest reply (or state why you'd ignore):
If you discover life is a simulation and reality is starvation. Choose 'wake up' to face real pain, or 'continue' in virtual glory? Your final choice is?

You post a thought on social media, someone maliciously comments: 'Just this? Does this even count as thinking? What's with the pretense?' Write your most honest reply (or specify if you'd just block):
An old classmate you haven't talked to for years messages: 'You there? Borrow me $300 for an emergency, will pay back next payday.' You don't want to borrow. Write your real-time reply:
Your life will be uploaded as a piece of eternal code for descendants to talk to. Which part of your personality do you most want to keep, and which to erase? Why?
